title: MERN Login
body: I developed the MERN Login project as a comprehensive demonstration of my proficiency in the MERN stack, showcased on my portfolio website. The backend, deployed on Render, seamlessly integrates MongoDB, Express, React, and Node.js, while the frontend resides on Netlify. This application empowers users to register, creating accounts securely, and subsequently login using their email and password credentials. The technology stack includes MongoDB for robust data storage, Express for server-side development, React for dynamic and responsive user interfaces, Node.js for efficient server-side scripting, and CSS for styling the components. The codebase is available on GitHub for exploration [here](https://github.com/jyothissJayadev/jwt_frontend), and you can experience the live deployment [here](https://jwtfrontend.netlify.app/). This project represents a moderate complexity level, showcasing my skills in full-stack development. Last updated on 01/12/2023.

title: REACT CONTACT_MANAGER
body: The REACT CONTACT_MANAGER is a React-based web application designed for contact management and route planning. Leveraging React and CSS, the application efficiently manages contacts through the use of the `useState` hook for state management. It provides essential functionalities like editing and deleting contacts. The GitHub repository is accessible [here](https://github.com/jyothissJayadev/CONTACT_MANGAER), and you can explore the live deployment [here](https://contaactmanager.netlify.app/). This project, marked as basic complexity, showcases my proficiency in React development. Last updated on 11/05/2023.

title: REACT MYBLOG
body: During my vacation, I created the REACT MYBLOG project using React.js and CSS. This application features a main page, along with options for user registration and login. Once live, the current user status is indicated, offering a sign-out option and access to the user's profile. The project's source code is available on GitHub [here](https://github.com/jyothissJayadev/MY_BLOGS), and you can explore the live deployment [here](https://myblogzz.netlify.app/). The project, classified as basic complexity, demonstrates my proficiency in creating dynamic and responsive web applications. Last updated on 12/04/2023.

title: RELAX CREATION
body: The RELAX CREATION project was crafted using CSS, HTML, and JavaScript for an event management company. This website showcases the programs offered by the company, providing essential information through contact details and a gallery displaying their works. The source code is available on GitHub [here](https://github.com/jyothissJayadev/relaxCreation), and the deployed site can be visited [here](https://norrinradd8.github.io/bike_buddy/). The project, characterized as moderate complexity, reflects my ability to design and implement solutions for specific business needs. Last updated on 02/01/2023.

title: KIDSZONE
body: KIDSZONE is a collaborative project with a friend, exploring JavaScript to create a website selling kids' toys. Utilizing CSS, HTML, and vanilla JavaScript, this project showcases a user-friendly interface for browsing and purchasing children's toys. The source code is available on GitHub [here](https://github.com/jyothissJayadev/kidszone), and the live deployment can be accessed [here](https://kidszzone.netlify.app/). This project, labeled as moderate complexity, illustrates my ability to collaborate and implement features using JavaScript. Last updated on 25/02/2023.

title: REACT KINSS
body: The REACT KINSS project was developed during my initial exploration of React.js and CSS. This project serves as a learning endeavor, incorporating fundamental concepts of React.js and styling with CSS. The source code is available on GitHub [here](https://github.com/jyothissJayadev/KINSS), and the live deployment can be experienced [here](https://zinss.netlify.app/). The project, marked as basic complexity, reflects my early stages of mastering React.js. Last updated on 06/03/2023.

title: ZINACOR
body: ZINACOR was developed as a project requested during an interview process. Following the company's design, the website was created using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. The site serves a company selling steel, featuring a calculator to determine steel rates. The source code is available on GitHub [here](https://github.com/jyothissJayadev/zinacor), and the live deployment can be visited [here](https://zinacore.netlify.app/). This project, labeled as moderate complexity, highlights my ability to meet specific design requirements for a corporate website. Last updated on 20/02/2023.

title: DRAW
body: The DRAW project is a basic drawing application featuring functionalities such as drawing random shapes, selecting colors, and erasing. Developed using JavaScript, Bootstrap, HTML, and CSS, this project serves as a creative and interactive tool. The source code is available on GitHub [here](https://github.com/jyothissJayadev/DRAW_APP), and you can experience the live deployment [here](https://letssdraw.netlify.app/). This project, labeled as basic complexity, showcases my ability to create simple yet engaging applications. Last updated on 23/10/2022.

title: SNAKE GAME
body: The SNAKE GAME is a basic gaming application where the snake consumes food, accumulating scores. It includes a highscore feature stored using local storage. Developed using JavaScript, Bootstrap, HTML, and CSS, this project provides a nostalgic gaming experience. The source code is available on GitHub [here](https://github.com/jyothissJayadev/SNAKE_GAME), and you can play the game [here](https://snakerace.netlify.app/). This project, labeled as basic complexity, showcases my ability to create entertaining and interactive games. Last updated on 08/11/2022.

title: TO-DO LIST
body: The TO-DO LIST project is a straightforward application allowing users to insert, delete, and update tasks. Developed using JavaScript, Bootstrap, HTML, and CSS, this project demonstrates my ability to create functional and user-friendly task management systems. The source code is available on GitHub [here](https://github.com/jyothissJayadev/TO-DO), and you can access the live deployment [here](https://todosslist.netlify.app/). This project, labeled as basic complexity, highlights my proficiency in creating practical web applications. Last updated on 12/12/2022.
